result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brendon D Smith

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brendon D Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter appeared by video for Brendon D Smith.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material from the State; however, has not had an opportunity to fully review discovery. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 09:00 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
Jury Trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Brendon D Smith not in court, in custody.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court for Brendon D Smith.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference . Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material from the State. Defense advised the Court Discovery material had recently been received and requested time to review material. State did not object. Court ordered case adjourned for Status hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Status hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 8:30 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Brendon D Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Allison Ritter appeared by video.  Abby Rockendorf in court, appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took Judicial Notice for case 19CF125. Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Detective D. Bettin.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with STK, dob 2/27/1996
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Brendon D Smith in court with attorney Maryann Corea.  Defendant Brendon D Smith in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Court advised defendant that due to nature of offense in Count 1 a sample of your DNA is required.  If the sheriff's department hasn't already obtained a sample I order them to do so.  There are circumstances that you can request the sample to be expunged from the data base pursuant to statute 165.77(4). DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Brendon D Smith
Current: 3130 S 47th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53219   (Effective: 08-15-2022)
Prior: 3826 West National Avenue #5, Milwaukee, WI 53215
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
